content:
@Grahame Grieve got a query from Lynn about the hai_ltcf IG. She has pushed it to hl7.org/fhir/us/hai-ltcf/2019Sep (ignore the giant logo). She says: "The registry at http://www.fhir.org/guides/registry has no description for the IG, and for whatever reason is not directing to the path with the suffix of 2019Sep (hl7.org/fhir/us/hai-ltcf/2019Sep)"

Is this something you need to update/fix?
description and path are in the package-list.json
scratch that path is in package-list
where is description for the registry?
No idea!
Description for the registry should come from the IG proposal
but where in the spec do you put it so it shows up?
Plus it's not IN the registry. The description is in the proposal.
HAI-LTCF is now in the registry
go to http://www.fhir.org/guides/registry/ and scroll to the very bottom. several igs are missing the description
Ok, I will get you the description.

I guess the short description? "Long term care facility (LTCF) healthcare-associated infection (HAI) reporting to CDC National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN) to track infections and prevention process measures in a systematic way, which allows identification of problems and care improvement."
Sorry @Lynn Laakso was confused/didn't read your message properly! Thought it wasn't there at all!
But I don't know where it goes....
Hmmmm... Neither do I. @Lloyd McKenzie ?
what is 'it'? the registry entry is built from the information in package-list.json. the registry doesn't reference ballots, only published iGS, I think

@Lynn Laakso is referring to description. There are a bunch of IGs that are missing it on the registry page (they are also missing Category):
pasted image

The registry is maintained in Git (https://github.com/FHIR/ig-registry). So I presume that Grahame/Lynn propagate the information from the proposal to the source in that project when they are working on migrating ballots.
there's code to do it, but it's only recent
ah the code says that those things have to be filled in by hand
technically, the description is supposed to come from the Short Description on the Implementation Guide proposal
fixed
though may take a little while to become visible
Awesome - thanks!
